Dialogue: That's a nice shovel you have, almost looks like mine.
Well actually, that is mine. Huh. Where'd you find it?
Next to the train tunnel? I wonder how it ended up there. . .
Well if I had my shovel I could start working right now, I got a few graves to dig. But it's finders keepers.
Ah. . . You're giving it to me. . . How thoughtful. . .
Guess my day off is ending early.
Not many people come up to this side of town.
Eli gave you the key here? How the hell did he get one? Haven't heard that name in a while . . .
Well, today I got my hands full.
Got the news this morning. Looks like it's three graves today, two kids and their caretaker.
I gotta get to work, but I lost my shovel.
Guess my day off is ending early.
Gravedigging is hard on the psyche. Without a shovel I guess I don't need to put myself through it for now.
I'm getting too old for this . . .
Got the news this morning. Looks like it's three graves today, two kids and their caretaker.
This job doesn't get any easier with age.
